disc: The main reason for postpartum haemorrhage is uterine atony which contributes to up to 80% of cases of postpartum haemorrhage (PPH). The large placental area and over distended uterus increase the risk of PPH. Other common reasons for PPH include genital tract injuries, placenta accreta or coagulopathies.
